sen.j: 綾部藩（あやべはん）は、丹波国（現在の京都府綾部市青野町、または同本宮町）に存在した藩。
sen.e: The domain of Ayabe is the one which existed in the Province of Tamba (Aono Town or Hongu Town, Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
The domain of Ayabe existed in the Province of Tamba (Aono Town or Hongu Town, Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
The Ayabe Domain existed in Tanba Province (Aono cho or Hongu cho, Ayabe City, Kyoto Prefecture in the present day).
sen.cmt: domain of→DomainProvince of Tamba→Tanba ProvinceTown→chothe Tanba Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 藩庁は綾部陣屋に置かれた。
sen.e: The seat of the domain was set in Ayabe-jinya.
The seat of the domain in Ayabe-jinya.
The seat of the domain in Ayabe-jinya.

sen.j: 綾部藩は寛永10年（1633年）3月5日に立藩した2万石の外様の藩である。
sen.e: The domain of Ayabe was the one with 20,000 koku ruled by an outside daimyo which became independent on March 5, 1633.
Becoming independent on March 5 1633, the domain of Ayabe had a yield of 20,000 koku in rice and was ruled by an outside daimyo.
sen.cmt: Modified the translation. I don't think it was the daimyo which became independent.
sen.e: Becoming independent on March 5, 1633, the Ayabe Domain had a yield of 20,000 koku in rice and was ruled by a tozama daimyo (the allied daimyo of the Tokugawa shogun).
sen.cmt: コンマ挿入outside daimyo→ tozama daimyo (the allied daimyo of the Tokugawa shogun)

sen.j: 藩祖は九鬼隆季で、戦国時代 (日本)に織田信長に仕えて名を馳せた水軍の将・九鬼嘉隆の孫である。
sen.e: The ancestor of the domain was Takasue KUKI, the grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI, the general of the navy who served Nobunaga ODA and achieved prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
The founder of the domain was Takasue KUKI, the grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI who was a general in the navy under Nobunaga ODA and achieved prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
The founder of the domain was Takasue KUKI, the grandson of Yoshitaka KUKI who was a general in the navy under Nobunaga ODA and achieved prominence in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 嘉隆の死後、九鬼氏は子の九鬼守隆が継いでいたが、その守隆が寛永9年（1632年）に死去すると、三男の隆季と五男の九鬼久隆との間で家督争いが起こった。
sen.e: After the death of Yoshitaka, his son Moritaka KUKI took over the Kuki family; however, when Moritaka died in 1632, Takasue the third son and Hisataka KUKI the fifth son fought for the head of the family.

After the death of Yoshitaka, his son Moritaka KUKI took over the Kuki family, but when Moritaka died in 1632, Takasue the third son and Hisataka KUKI the fifth son fought each other to become head of the family.

After the death of Yoshitaka, his son Moritaka KUKI took over the Kuki clan, but when Moritaka died in 1632, Takasue the third son and Hisataka KUKI the fifth son fought each other to become head of the family.

sen.j: これは守隆が生前に五男の久隆を溺愛して嫡男に選んでしまったのが原因であるが、結果として御家騒動の結果、久隆は摂津国三田藩へ移封され、隆季は綾部にそれぞれ移封され、ここに九鬼氏は嘉隆以来の故郷である志摩国鳥羽藩の地を失うに至ったのであった。
sen.e: It was because Moritaka doted on Hisataka the fifth son during his life and had chosen him as his heir; as a result of this family trouble, Hisataka was transferred to the domain of Sanda in the Province of Settsu and Takasue to the domain of Ayabe, and the Kuki family had lost the land of the domain of Toba in the Province of Shima, their hometown since the era of Yoshitaka.

The dispute took place because Moritaka had doted on Hisataka the fifth son and chosen him as his heir, and the result was the transfer of Hisataka to the domain of Sanda in the Province of Settsu and Takasue to the domain of Ayabe, leading to the loss of the domain of Toba in Shima Province, which had been hometown of the Kuki family since the era of Yoshitaka.
sen.cmt: Changed for readability. Also changed "the province of Shima" to "Shima province" as per the term list of July 31st.
sen.e: The dispute took place because Moritaka had doted on Hisataka, the fifth son and chosen him as his heir, and the result was the transfer of Hisataka to the Sanda Domain in Settsu Province and of Takasue to the Ayabe Domain, leading to the loss of the Toba Domain in Shima Province, which had been the hometown of the Kuki clan since the era of Yoshitaka.
sen.cmt: 句点必要。: “doted on Hisataka the fifth son”->”doted on Hisataka, the fifth son”. of が抜けている。: “and Takasue to”-> “and of Takasue to”. 不定冠詞必要。 “been hometown”-> “been the hometown”.the Settsu Province の定冠詞 the 不要

sen.j: 隆季は寛文元年（1661年）3月28日、弟の九鬼隆重に500石を分与し、分家を創設している。
sen.e: Takasue allocated 500 koku to his younger brother Takashige KUKI on March 28, 1661 and founded a branch family.
Takasue allocated 500 koku to his younger brother Takashige KUKI on March 28, 1661 and founded a branch family.
Takasue allocated 500 koku to his younger brother Takashige KUKI on March 28, 1661 and founded a branch family.

sen.j: また、隆季は城下町の建設や検地などを行なって藩政の基礎を固めた。
sen.e: Takasue also created a castle town and implemented a land survey, and strengthened the base of the domain duties.
Takasue also created a castle town and implemented a land survey to strengthened the administrative base of the domain.
Takasue also created a castle town and implemented a land survey to strengthen the administrative base of the domain.

sen.j: しかし第2代藩主・九鬼隆常の代から大洪水や暴風雨による天災が起こって3,729人もの死者を出すなど、早くも藩政の衰退が始まる。
sen.e: However, in the period of Takatsune KUKI, the second lord, the domain duties had already started to decline; they had 3,729 death because of the act of nature such as heavy flood and rain storm.

However, in the period of Takatsune KUKI, the second lord, the domain adminstration had already started to decline after various natural disasters, such heavy flooding and rain storms which killed 3,729 people.

However, in the period of Takatsune KUKI, the second lord, the domain administration had already started to decline after various natural disasters, such as heavy flooding and rain storms which killed 3,729 people.
sen.cmt: as が抜けている。 “ such heavy ”-> “ such as heavy ”

sen.j: その後も再三にわたって大洪水や大旱魃、大飢饉などが発生して藩は大被害を受け、第3代藩主・九鬼隆直の時代には藩財政が破綻し、藩札発行や倹約令制定、家臣団の給米減封などを中心とした財政改革が試みられたが、その後も大洪水などによる天災や百姓一揆までもが発生し、藩政はすっかり衰退してしまった。
sen.e: The domain was damaged heavily by great flood, drought, and famine repeatedly afterward, and the finance of the domain collapsed in the era of Takanao KUKI, the third lord of the domain; the financial reform was pursued such as issuance of domain currency, establishment of thrift ordinance, and reduction of rice distribution to vassals, but act of nature caused by great flood and even peasant's revolt occurred after that and the domain duties had fully weakened.

Thereafter, the domain was repeatedly assailed by flooding, droughts, and famine, and its finances collapsed in the era of Takanao KUKI, the third lord of the domain, who pursued reforms as the issue of a domain currency, reduction in spending on weapons, and a reduction in the amount of rice distributed to vassals, but this was followed by more flooding and even a peasant's revolt, and the administration was severely weakened.

Thereafter, the domain was repeatedly assailed by flooding, droughts, and famine, and its finances collapsed in the era of Takanao KUKI, the third lord of the domain, who pursued reforms as the issue of a domain currency, reduction in spending on weapons, and a reduction in the amount of rice distributed to vassals, but this was followed by more flooding and even a peasant's revolt, and the administration was severely weakened.

sen.j: なお、隆直の時代に藩校・進徳館が設立されている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Shintokukan, the clan school, was founded in the period of Takanao.
Takanao did, however, manage to establish Shintokukan, a clan school.
Takanao did, however, manage to establish Shintokukan, a clan school.

sen.j: このような中で第9代藩主・九鬼隆都は佐藤信淵や奥山弘平らを招聘して農業政策を中心とした藩政改革に取り組み、さらに山鹿素水を招いて軍事の改革も行なった。
sen.e: In this context, Takahiro KUKI, the 9th lord of the domain, invited Nobuhiro SATO and Hirohira OKUYAMA to work on the reform of the domain duties focusing on agricultural policies; in addition, he invited Sosui YAMAGA to reform the military affairs.

With the domain administration in this weakened state, Takahiro KUKI, the 9th lord of the domain, invited Nobuhiro SATO and Hirohira OKUYAMA to work on reforming of the domain administration, focusing on agricultural policies, and invited Sosui YAMAGA to reform military affairs.

With the domain administration in this weakened state, Takahiro KUKI, the ninth lord of the domain, invited Nobuhiro SATO and Hirohira OKUYAMA to work on reforming the domain administration, focusing on agricultural policies, and invited Sosui YAMAGA to reform military affairs.
sen.cmt: of不必要。. “ reforming of the”-> “ reforming the”

sen.j: 隆都は弘化4年（1847年）に木綿会所を創設して専売制を実施し、藩財政をいくらかは再建することに成功した。
sen.e: Takahiro established a momen-kaisho and introduced a system of monopoly in 1847, and was successful to revive the finance of the domain.
In 1847Takahiro established a cotton syndicate and introduced a system of monoply, and was successful in reviving the finances of the domain.
In 1847 Takahiro established a cotton syndicate and introduced a system of monopoly, and was successful in reviving the finances of the domain to some extent.
sen.cmt: スペース削除、挿入 to some extent補足スペル

sen.j: 幕末期の動乱に入ると、隆都は文久元年（1861年）6月10日に家督を子の九鬼隆備に譲って隠居する。
sen.e: When entered into the turbulent times at the end of Edo Period, Takahiro relinquished the position of the head of the family to his son Takamoto KUKI and retired on June 10, 1861.
In the turbulent times at the end of Edo period, Takahiro relinquished the position of the head of the family to his son Takamoto KUKI, retiring on June 10, 1861.
In the turbulent times at the end of Edo period, Takahiro relinquished the position of the head of the family to his son Takamoto KUKI, retiring on June 10, 1861.

sen.j: 隆備ははじめ佐幕派であったが、禁門の変で御所の警備を務めた頃から次第に官軍側に与するようになり、慶応4年（1868年）1月には西園寺公望を通じていち早く新政府側に帰順した。
sen.e: At first Takamoto was a supporter of the shogun, but he began to go over to the government army side since the period when he served as a guard of the old imperial palace at Hamaguri Rebellion; in January 1868, he returned to the new government quickly through Kinmochi SAIONJI..

Takamoto initially supported the shogun, but began to lean towards the government army side after serving as a guard of the old imperial palace during the Hamaguri Rebellion, and, in January 1868, he quickly took the side of the new government with the help of Kinmochi SAIONJI.
sen.cmt: Changed for readability. But was not sure what was meant by "through Kinmochi SAIONJI".
sen.e: Takamoto initially supported the shogun, but began to lean towards the government army side after serving as a guard of the old imperial palace during the Hamaguri Rebellion, and, in January 1868, he quickly took the side of the new government with the help of Kinmochi SAIONJI.

sen.j: その後、隆備は版籍奉還により藩知事となり、明治4年（1871年）の廃藩置県により綾部藩は廃藩となる。
sen.e: Takamoto became the governor of the domain after that as a result of the return of lands and people to the emperor, and the domain of Ayabe was abolished because of the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures in 1871.
Under the rules of the return of lands to the emperor, Takamoto then became the governor of the domain before it was abolished in the abolition of clans and establishment of prefectures in 1871.
Under the rules of the return of lands to the emperor, Takamoto then became the governor of the domain before it was abolished in the abolition of domains and establishment of prefectures in 1871.

sen.j: その後、綾部県を経て、京都府に編入されることとなった。
sen.e: After becoming Ayabe Prefecture, it was transferred to Kyoto Prefecture.
After becoming Ayabe Prefecture, it then became part of Kyoto Prefecture.
After becoming Ayabe Prefecture, it then became part of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: ちなみに隆備も父に劣らず有能で、藩校・進徳館を篤信館と改名し、その翌年には藩内6ヶ所に郷学校を設立して、庶民教育に尽力した。
sen.e: Takamoto was no less competent than his father was; he changed the name of Shintokukan, the clan school, to Tokushinkan, and founded six go-schools and was committed to the education of general public.
Takamoto was just as capabable as his father, and committed himself to the education of the people, changing the name of Shintokukan, the clan school, to Tokushinkan and founding six local schools.

Takamoto was just as capable as his father, and committed himself to the education of the people, changing the name of Shintokukan, the clan school, to Tokushinkan and founding six local schools in the following year.
sen.cmt: in the following year補足スペル

sen.j: これは後に、明治政府による近代化教育の先駆けとなったのである。
sen.e: Afterward, this led the modern education by the Meiji Government.
This was a precursor to the modern education introduced by the Meiji Government.
This was a precursor to the modern educational system introduced by the Meiji Government.

tit.e: List of lords of the domain in chronological order
The chronological order of the Lords.
tit.cmt: フィードバックにより統一しました。

sen.j: 外様。
sen.e: The outside daimyo.
Outside daimyo
The tozama daimyo (the allied daimyo of the Tokugawa shogun)
sen.cmt: 他記事と合わせました。

sen.e: 20,000 koku to 19,500 koku.
20,000 koku to 19,500 koku.
20,000 koku to 19,500 koku.

sen.j: 九鬼隆季（たかすえ）【寛永10年3月5日藩主就任－延宝2年（1674年）11月16日隠居】
sen.e: Takasue KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on March 5, 1633, retired on November 16, 1674)
Takasue KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 5, 1633, retired on November 16, 1674)
Takasue KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 5, 1633, retired on November 16, 1674)

sen.j: 九鬼隆常（たかつね）【延宝2年11月16日藩主就任－元禄11年（1698年）4月1日死去】
sen.e: Takatsune KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on November 16, 1674, died on April 1, 1698)
Takatsune KUKI (became the lord of the domain on November 16, 1674, died on April 1, 1698)
Takatsune KUKI (became the lord of the domain on November 16, 1674, died on April 1, 1698)

sen.j: 九鬼隆直（たかなお）【元禄11年5月藩主就任－正徳 (日本)3年（1713年）1月晦日隠居】
sen.e: Takanao KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain in May, 1698, retired at the end of January, 1713)
Takanao KUKI (became the lord of the domain in May, 1698, retired at the end of January, 1713)
Takanao KUKI (became the lord of the domain in May, 1698, retired at the end of January, 1713)

sen.j: 九鬼隆寛（たかのぶ）【正徳3年1月晦日藩主就任－明和3年（1766年）3月8日隠居】
sen.e: Takanobu KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain at the end of January, 1713, retired on March 8, 1766)
Takanobu KUKI (became the lord of the domain at the end of January, 1713, retired on March 8, 1766)
Takanobu KUKI (became the lord of the domain at the end of January, 1713, retired on March 8, 1766)

sen.j: 九鬼隆貞（たかさだ）【明和3年3月8日藩主就任－安永9年（1780年）12月12日死去】
sen.e: Takasada KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on March 8, 1766, died on December 12, 1780)
Takasada KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 8, 1766, died on December 12, 1780)
Takasada KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 8, 1766, died on December 12, 1780)

sen.j: 九鬼隆棋（たかよし）【天明元年（1781年）3月12日藩主就任－天明7年（1787年）1月晦日死去】
sen.e: Takayoshi KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on March 12, 1781, died at the end of January, 1787)
Takayoshi KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 12, 1781, died at the end of January, 1787)
Takayoshi KUKI (became the lord of the domain on March 12, 1781, died at the end of January, 1787)

sen.j: 九鬼隆郷（たかさと）【天明7年4月7日藩主就任－文化 (元号)5年（1808年）5月晦日死去】
sen.e: Takasato KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on April 7, 1787, died at the end of May, 1808)
Takasato KUKI (became the lord of the domain on April 7, 1787, died at the end of May, 1808)
Takasato KUKI (became the lord of the domain on April 7, 1787, died at the end of May, 1808)

sen.j: 九鬼隆度（たかのり）【文化5年7月5日藩主就任－文政5年（1822年）閏1月24日隠居】
sen.e: Takanori KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on July 5, 1808, retired on January 24, 1822)
Takanori KUKI (became the lord of the domain on July 5, 1808, retired on January 24, 1822)
Takanori KUKI (became the lord of the domain on July 5, 1808, retired on January 24, 1822)

sen.j: 九鬼隆都（たかひろ）【文政5年閏1月24日藩主就任－文久元年6月10日隠居】
sen.e: Takahiro KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on January 24, 1822) and retired on June 10, 1861)
Takahiro KUKI (became the lord of the domain on January 24, 1822) and retired on June 10, 1861)
Takahiro KUKI (became the lord of the domain on January 24, 1822 and retired on June 10, 1861)

sen.j: 九鬼隆備（たかとも）【文久元年6月10日藩主就任－明治4年（1871年）藩知事免官】
sen.e: Takatomo KUKI (assumed the lord of the domain on June 10, 1861, discharged the governor of the domain in 1871)
Takatomo KUKI (became the lord of the domain on June 10, 1861, discharged the governor of the domain in 1871)
Takatomo KUKI (became the lord of the domain on June 10, 1861, discharged the governor of the domain in 1871)

sen.j: 明治
sen.e: Meiji
Meiji
Meiji

sen.j: 九鬼隆治 -1980.3.25 1919皇道宣揚会を設立し､総裁 享年96
sen.e: Takaharu KUKI - March 25, 1980 1919 Established Kodosenyokai and became the president, died at 96
Takaharu KUKI - Established and led Kodosenyokai, a martial arts association, from 1919, died aged 96 in March 25, 1980
sen.cmt: Original translation is unclear, so I have interpreted it as best as I could. Also, after refering to Kodosenyokai[http://www.shinjin.co.jp/kuki/hyoho/faq_e.htm], I added "a martial arts organisation".
sen.e: Takaharu KUKI - Established and led Kodosenyokai, a martial arts association, from 1919, died aged 96 in March 25, 1980

sen.j: 九鬼宗隆 -2003.6.27 前･熊野本宮大社宮司/隆治の長男 享年90
sen.e: Munetaka KUKI - June 27, 2003, the first son of Takaharu, the former chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, died at 90
Munetaka KUKI - the first son of Takaharu, the former chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, died aged 90 in June 27, 2003
sen.cmt: First translation confusing. I have interpreted as best I could but this requires checking.
sen.e: Munetaka KUKI - the first son of Takaharu, the former chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine, died aged 90 in June 27, 2003

sen.j: 九鬼家隆 現･熊野本宮大社宮司/宗隆の長男
sen.e: Ietaka KUKI The first son of Munetaka, the current chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine
Ietaka KUKI The first son of Munetaka and the current chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine
sen.cmt: First translation confusing. I have interpreted as best I could but this requires checking.
sen.e: Ietaka KUKI The first son of Munetaka and the current chief priest of Kumanohongu-taisha Shrine
